comment: this schema was induced using non-real documents (generated from GPT3)

children.comment: This is only a child because can only be one root node.

events.name: bankruptcy
events.ta1explanation: event when a company declares bankruptcy.

events.name: acquisition
events.ta1explanation: A company is acquired by another company.

events.name: merger
events.ta1explanation: Two companies combine to make a bigger company.

events.name: divestment
events.ta1explanation: Company divests asset.

events.name: Shutdown
events.ta1explanation: Company has to close for some reason.

events.name: Reorganization
events.ta1explanation: Company is reorganized. Often because of bankruptcy.

events.name: founding
events.ta1explanation: Someone starts a company.

events.name: inquiry
events.ta1explanation: An invesigation, usually by the government. Maybe it could also be an audit.

events.name: Corporate Justice
events.ta1explanation: Corporate to distinguish from the person version.

events.name: PoliticalCorruption
events.ta1explanation: The execs send money to their politician friends who pull some strings.

events.name: Corruption
events.ta1explanation: Some form of corruption occurs.

events.name: Response
events.ta1explanation: This is the response to the invesigation, usually by the government.

events.name: IPO
events.ta1explanation: The company undergoes an initial public offering (IPO) and lists itself on the stock market.

events.name: PrivateFunding
events.ta1explanation: The company raises money from private investors (the opportunity is not available to the public).

events.name: exchange_of_goods
events.ta1explanation: Company sells assets.
events.qlabel: transfer of equivalent goods to each other

events.name: Privatize
events.ta1explanation: Buy stock and go private

participants.comment: maybe this should be a more generic entity?

events.name: assign
events.ta1explanation: Government assigns trustee

events.name: trial
events.ta1explanation: Trustee manages bankruptcy case.

events.name: Transfer Money
events.ta1explanation: Transfer money.

events.name: Executive Bonus
events.ta1explanation: The executives get a big bonus. It's in the news when it's bigger than they deserve. Sometimes called a golden parachute.

events.name: Management Change
events.ta1explanation: The management is changed. This often happens in an acquired company after an acquisition.

events.name: Government Bailout
events.ta1explanation: The government loans a lot of money to a company when it's 'too big too fail' without damaging the economy.

events.name: Create Partnership
events.ta1explanation: Two companies partner together to do something mutually beneficial. They remain seperate entities, however.

events.name: End Partnership
events.ta1explanation: Two companies decide their partnership isn't worth it anymore.
events.comment: don't think this is specific enough

events.name: ExitBankruptcy
events.ta1explanation: Leaving bankruptcy.

events.name: Fine
events.ta1explanation: The government fines a company for doing something wrong.

events.name: Propose Merger
events.ta1explanation: Two companies decide to try and become one company.

events.name: Propose Acquisition
events.ta1explanation: One company proposes acquiring another company.

events.name: agreement
events.ta1explanation: The government will allow the companies to do what they want (often merger or acquisition).

events.name: rejection
events.ta1explanation: The government says no to some regulated action the companies want to do (often merger or acquisition).

events.name: Corporate Criminal Response
events.ta1explanation: To distinguish from criminal response against people. Also verdict qnode might be bad.

events.name: Corporate Criminal Inquiry
events.ta1explanation: This is when the corporation itself is investigated and not a person. Not sure if this is the best way to manage the difference.

events.name: arrest
events.ta1explanation: Executives are arrested for crimes they committed carrying out their duties.

events.name: breakup
events.ta1explanation: Government breaks up a company. Qnode is very bad.

events.name: Antitrust Investigation
events.ta1explanation: Investigate if corporation is a monopoly.

events.name: agreement
events.ta1explanation: The government decides a company is a monopoly and it's time to trust-bust it.

events.name: rejection
events.ta1explanation: The government decides a company is not a monopoly.

events.name: agreement
events.ta1explanation: The government decides a corporation broke the law.

events.name: rejection
events.ta1explanation: The government decides a corporation did not break the law.

events.name: dismissal
events.ta1explanation: A bunch of employees are fired.

events.name: Ask Shareholders
events.ta1explanation: Get shareholder approval for something.

events.name: agreement
events.ta1explanation: Shareholders approve a proposal from the company (e.g. acquisition or merger).

events.name: rejection
events.ta1explanation: Shareholders reject a proposal from the company (e.g. acquisition or merger).

events.name: GovernmentActions
events.comment: general parent node. An alternative Qnode was bureaucracy

events.name: Identifycategorize
events.ta1explanation: Investigation of the disease outbreak includes identify the source of the virus as well as the suspect of the creator

events.name: Contact
events.ta1explanation: Make contact with the suspect

events.name: Arrest
events.ta1explanation: Taking the suspect who created the virus or violated laws during the outbreak into custody

events.name: Inspect
events.ta1explanation: Organized examination or formal evaluation on the suspect for creating the virus

events.name: Initiate Judicial Process
events.ta1explanation: Initiate a legal proceeding on the suspect for creating the virus

events.name: ChargeIndict
events.ta1explanation: Formal accusation made by a governmental authority on the suspect for creating the virus

events.name: Trial

children.comment: Added this to avoid multiple roots.

events.ta1explanation: Coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunals on the case of creation of the virus

events.name: Convict
events.ta1explanation: The suspect may found guilty of creating the virus

events.name: Sentence
events.ta1explanation: Punishment, penalty or physical restraint that was actually imposed on the criminal responsible for creating the virus

events.name: Detain
events.ta1explanation: A state or private citizen lawfully holds the criminal responsible for creating the virus by removing their freedom or liberty at that time

events.name: Release Parole
events.ta1explanation: Release or early release of the criminal responsible for creating the virus

events.name: Acquit
events.ta1explanation: In common law jurisdictions, an acquittal certifies that the accused is free from the charge of an offense, as far as the criminal law is concerned

events.name: Handcuffing
events.ta1explanation: Using handcuffs to secure a suspect who violated law during the disease outbreak

events.name: Interrogation
events.ta1explanation: Interviewing with the goal of eliciting useful information related to suspected crime during the disease outbreak

events.name: Restrain
events.ta1explanation: Physical restraint on the suspect

entities.name: company
entities.comment: the legal entity for events with more than 1 company.

entities.name: company
entities.comment: the legal entity for events with more than 1 company.

entities.name: personnel for events with more than 1
personnel for events with more than 1
